intro: Willemetia hieracioides, commonly known as the small-centre rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing shrub with small, evergreen leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is drought-tolerant. It is often found in coastal areas and mountainous regions where it adapts well to harsh environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it a hardy and ornamental plant suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
